intro: Neea pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Mexico and Central America. It is a small, woody shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale green. Its fruits are small, dry berries that contain several seeds. Neea pittieri is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
